search.query: | tstats `cs_summariesonly_authentication` count from datamodel=Cyences_Authentication where `cs_radius_authentication_indexes` Authentication.dest_category="radius_auth" by Authentication.app | rename "Authentication.app" as app

html.p: This dashboard includes all authentication attempts related to Radius.

If the data is present in Splunk but isn't being displayed by this dashboard, please check the mapping and support by Cyences App. And also check "Radius Authentication Data (indexes)" macro (cs_radius_authentication_indexes) definition (Settings > Configuration).

search.query: `cs_radius_authentication_indexes` dest_category="radius_auth" | head 1 | stats count | eval data=if(count>0, "Data Present", "Data Not Present"), label="`cs_radius_authentication_indexes` dest_category=radius_auth" | table label, data

| tstats `cs_summariesonly_authentication` prestats=t count as count, dc(Authentication.user) as dc_users from datamodel=Cyences_Authentication where `cs_radius_authentication_indexes` Authentication.dest_category="radius_auth" Authentication.action IN ("success","failure") Authentication.app=$tkn_app|s$ by _time Authentication.action | timechart span=1h count, dc(Authentication.user) by Authentication.action | eval "Unique Users"='dc(Authentication.user): failure'+'dc(Authentication.user): success' | fields - "dc(Authentication.user): failure", "dc(Authentication.user): success" | rename "count: failure" as "Failure", "count: success" as "Success"

html.p: Description: Displays unusual behavior for users with a large number of failure attempts and abnormal behavior from the number of unique users.

search.query: | tstats `cs_summariesonly_authentication` prestats=t count from datamodel=Cyences_Authentication where `cs_radius_authentication_indexes` Authentication.dest_category="radius_auth" Authentication.action IN ("success","failure") Authentication.app=$tkn_app|s$ by Authentication.app Authentication.action | `drop_dm_object_name(Authentication)` | chart count by app action | addtotals | eval "Success%" = round(success / Total * 100,2) | fields - Total | rename failure as "Failure", success as "Success" | sort + "Success%"

html.p: Description: A low authentication success rate should be further investigated to determine if this is an issue for a single user or of greater impact.

search.query: | tstats `cs_summariesonly_authentication` count as count, latest(_time) as last_login from datamodel=Cyences_Authentication where `cs_radius_authentication_indexes` Authentication.dest_category="radius_auth" Authentication.action IN ("success","failure") Authentication.app=$tkn_app|s$ Authentication.user=$tkn_user|s$ by Authentication.user, Authentication.app, Authentication.action | `drop_dm_object_name(Authentication)` | eval over_field=user." - ".app | chart sum(count) as count, max(last_login) as last_login over over_field by action | rex field=over_field "(?<user>.*) - (?<app>.*)" | fields - over_field | rename "count: failure" as failure, "count: success" as success, "last_login: success" as last_success_login, "last_login: failure" as last_failed_login | `cs_human_readable_time_format(last_success_login)` | `cs_human_readable_time_format(last_failed_login)` | table user, app, success, last_success_login, failure, last_failed_login | fillnull success, failure value=0 | sort -failure, -success
